attributes.action: The NHS should be given a V.C or G.M like Malta was during the war
attributes.additional_details: They should be rewarded for risking their lives to save others
attributes.background: Many NHS workers have lost their lives saving overs

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions that call for specific awards or honours, such as the George Cross, to be given to individuals or organisations, because we can only accept petitions about matters for which the Government or Parliament are responsible for. There is an independent process for considering nominations for awards and honours, including the George Cross, and advising the Queen on granting these, so it is not something the Government or Parliament can do.

Information about Civilian gallantry is available here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/civilian-gallantry-operation#the-george-cross-committee

And details of how to nominate someone for an honour or award are available here: https://www.gov.uk/honours/recommend-bravery-award

You might like to sign some of the following petitions: 

Award Covid-19 medals to all emergency services and involved armed forces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

A memorial for NHS, care, allied professionals, who die as a result of COVID:19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313328

Designate a day for the recognition of our NHS and all Emergency Services: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308614
